data: MED Diabetic Ketoacidosis (DKA) Adult 19 Years and Older - Stabilization VGH (Module) -  prototype
Select this module if patient has stabilized and is ready for transfer to inpatient General Medicine unit
Notify provider if capillary blood glucose falls below 10 mmol/L
Goal is to maintain insulin regular human infusion until ketosis resolves and maintain serum potassium 4 to 5 mmol/L
Goal is to maintain insulin regular human infusion until ketosis resolves and maintain serum potassium 4 to 5 mmol/L
DKA Solution 1 (Fluid Replacement and Maintenance), DKA Solution 2 (Insulin Infusion) to be infused concurrently
Bolus Fluids, if no bolus required, refer to maintenance fluids
If capillary blood glucose is greater than or equal to 14 mmol/L
2,000 mL, IV, once, administer over: 1 hour, drug form: bag
1,000 mL, IV, once, administer over: 1 hour, drug form: bag
500 mL, IV, once, administer over: 1 hour, drug form: bag
Maintenance fluids to be given after bolus is completed
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 150 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
DKA Solution 2 (Glucose AND / OR Potassium Replacement)
When selecting solution 2, consider need for glucose and / or replacement
If capillary blood glucose is greater than or equal to 14 mmol/L
Provider to order if capillary blood glucose 10 to 14 mmol/L

Continue insulin infusion until ketosis resolves as defined by:  - Beta-hydroxybutyrate normalized AND either one of the following two criteria:  - pH 7.3 or more or CALCULATED Anion gap (not automated) 13 or less   (calculated anion gap = Na – (Cl + HCO3))  - Serum bicarbonate greater than 15 mmol/L or glucose less than 11 mmol/L    Consider conversion to SUBCUTANEOUS insulin when patient is eating and drinking and ketosis is  resolved. Discontinue insulin IV infusion 2 hours after first dose of subcutaneous insulin
insulin regular continuous infusion (1 unit/mL) in NS standard
unit, subcutaneous, as directed, PRN, drug form: inj
Discontinue all previous potassium chloride and insulin orders
Additional potassium replacement with DKA Solution 2
20 mmol, IV, q1h, PRN hypokalemia, administer over: 1 hour, drug form: bag
Electrolytes Panel (Na, K, Cl, CO2, Anion Gap)
Blood, STAT, Collection: T;N, q2h interval
